entries.text: Thank you for calling customer support. To assist you faster, please say the nature of your call.
Order status. I want to know where my order is.
Please provide your order number or tracking number.
Thank you. Please give me a moment to access your order. Okay, I see order 12345ABCDE. Can I help you?
Yes, when will I get my order? I need a shipping update. It was supposed to arrive days ago.
According to the system, the scheduled delivery was for the 20th. Let me check the package location.
Okay, it seems the package is currently in transit. The last update shows it at a distribution center in Atlanta.
Atlanta? I live in Seattle! What is it doing in Atlanta? This is ridiculous!
I understand your frustration. Let me see if I can get more specific information. The tracking number is XYZ789. You can also track it yourself using that.
I already tracked it! That's how I know it's in Atlanta! The tracking number gives me no new information. I want to know *why* it's in Atlanta and when I'm *actually* going to get it.
I apologize for the inconvenience. I can escalate this to our shipping department to investigate the package location further. It will take 24-48 hours for them to respond.
24 to 48 hours? Are you serious? I needed this package last week! This is completely unacceptable. Is there anything, *anything* you can do *now*?

I understand your frustration, and I wish I could provide a more immediate solution. However, I don't have direct access to the shipping logistics. Escalating the issue is the fastest way to get a detailed shipping update. We can also look into providing a partial refund for the delay once the package arrives.
A partial refund? Are you kidding me? I needed this thing! This is beyond frustrating. This is the last time I ever order from your company!
Forget it! This is a waste of time.
